DESCRIPTION: A unique 8-digit identifier for each sales order. This is used to track orders from creation to fulfillment.
The date when the sales order was created. Important for tracking the processing timeline and managing delivery expectations.
The delivery date requested by the customer, used to align the internal delivery process with customer expectations.
The classification of the sales order type, such as standard, return, or subscription orders.
The total amount of tax applied to the sales order. Calculated based on the applicable tax rates.
The total cost of the products in the sales order. Useful for calculating profit margins and understanding product cost.
The total amount for the products or services sold. This includes product prices and applicable taxes.
The internal business unit responsible for managing the sales order. Used for tracking performance by organization.
The channel through which the sale is made, such as direct sales, retail, or online.
A unique identifier for the customer placing the order. Used for managing customer details and purchase history.
The geographic region or district assigned to the sale. Useful for tracking sales performance by location.
A unique identifier for the payer who is responsible for the payment of the sales order.
The code for the sales employee responsible for managing the order. Used to track the performance of individual sales reps.
The name of the sales representative responsible for the order. Important for managing customer relationships and sales follow-ups.
The division responsible for the product sold. Helps track which department is accountable for the product or service.
The group or category to which the product belongs. Useful for managing and organizing similar types of products.
The name of the product or material sold, used for identification and management purposes.
